docs.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-13 Congress Votes Down Foreign Policy Proposals Congress voted down a White House plan to make overdue payments to the United Nations and rejected contributing more money to the I.M.F. for financial crises. A1
docs.snippet: INTERNATIONAL   A3-13    Congress Votes Down Foreign Policy Proposals  Congress voted down a White House plan to make overdue payments to the United Nations and rejected contributing more money to the I.M.F. for financial crises.   A1

docs.lead_paragraph: An article in Science Times on Oct. 7 about the effect of grapefruit juice on the body's absorption of certain drugs misspelled the surname of a researcher on the subject. He is Dr. Paul Pisarek, not Pizarek. A telephone caller reported the error last week.
docs.abstract: Correction of October 7 Science Times article on effect of grapefruit juice on body's absorption of certain drugs
docs.snippet: An article in Science Times on Oct. 7 about the effect of grapefruit juice on the body's absorption of certain drugs misspelled the surname of a researcher on the subject. He is Dr. Paul Pisarek, not Pizarek. A telephone caller reported the error...

docs.lead_paragraph: IN May 1987 Mary Obringer and her husband adopted a 5-month-old South Korean infant. But there were problems with the baby they named Max. ''He had speech disabilities, motor skill problems, was hyperactive and had trouble concentrating,'' Ms. Obringer said. He could not be in a large group of people without hitting, kicking and screaming. When he was 5, they started him in school in their hometown, Jackson, Wyo., ''and it was clear right away he wasn't going to be able to stay,'' Ms. Obringer said. Doctors diagnosed his condition as attention deficit disorder, and put him on the drug Ritalin, which helped. But he still had numerous problems and stayed in a classroom for special students.

headline.main: Biofeedback Offers Help To Hyperactive Children

docs.abstract: Hyperactive children are being treated with EEG biofeedback or neurofeedback; technique displays patient's brain waves on video screen, which, along with special video games, allows children and doctors to exert new level of control over brain waves; one woman describes how treatment helped her son, reducing his dependence on Ritalin; major proponent of neurofeedback is Dr Joel Lubar (M)
